This patch in introduces an alternative shorthand syntax for enconded output in the AspView view engine, that allows for better Intellisense capabilities within VS 2005: <%=( value )%>
The AspView parser interprets the parenthesis as enconded output and since ( ) is valid syntax, yet coputationally neutral, in both VB.Net and C#, the user will still get full Intellisense capabilities.
Note: There should be no white space before or after the parenthesis.
For example, this will not generate encoded output: <%= ( value ) %>
